Former French president Sarkozy jailed
subhead: Convicted of criminal conspiracy over a scheme to obtain Libyan financing for his 2007 presidential campaign, Nicolas Sarkozy started serving a five-year sentence on Tuesday. He has appealed the verdict and his lawyers have requested an early release.

title: A Gaza hospital director remains imprisoned by Israel
subhead: Hussam Abu Safiya, director of the main hospital in northern Gaza, has remained imprisoned by Israel for more than nine months without any official charges brought against him, historian Jean-Pierre Filiu reports in his column.

title: Hermès appoints Grace Wales Bonner as creative director of menswear collections
subhead: The British designer takes over the men's collections at the Parisian luxury house. She succeeds Véronique Nichanian, who held the post for 37 years.

title: How Gustave Courbet's 'Le Désespéré' came to be owned by Qatar
subhead: The emirate purchased the painting for around €50 million about a decade ago from a French family and has agreed to loan it to the Musée d'Orsay for five years.

title: Zaho de Sagazan: 'Without others, without friendship, you can't achieve much'
